metadata.title: CVE-2018-20685 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In OpenSSH 7.9, scp.c in the scp client allows remote SSH servers to bypassintended access restrictions via the filename of . or an empty filename.The impact is modifying the permissions of the target directory on theclient side.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20685` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.9p1-5
openssh-server - 1:7.9p1-5
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.9p1-5
openssh-tests - 1:7.9p1-5
ssh - 1:7.9p1-5
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.9p1-5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openssh package in fips-updates/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:7.9p1-5').
openssh-ssh1 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
